column4: Hi. Whenever I run SYBYL-X (Chemical simulation software) I get the error message "undefined symbol glColorTableEXT"
undefined symbol glColorTableEXT <---- what does that mean?
your opengl driver doesnt support GL Color Tables
is there a way of fixing that? :|
your could try a different opengl implementation
Excuse me, I forgot to raise the n00b flag. How can I do that?
what kind of video card do you have
ATI technologies Inc M860G mobility radeon
I'm currently using the ATI/AMD prop FGLRX graphics driver
you could try the radeonhd it might support more gl extensions, but it would be slower
is that on synaptic?
nope, it's not
you would need to disable the fglrx and install radeonhd. i wouldn't recommend this unless you absolutely MUST have this program working
Well, yes I must have it. But perhaps there are other options, considering this one seems to be rather extreme
you might try recompiling the program and commenting out the glColorTableExt references
that's beyond my ability. The program came with an installer and I didn't see any options that permitted a re-compiling.
the exact error message is "/home/tripos/sybyl-x12/lib/linux/libmolcadplus.so: undefined symbol glColorTableEXT"
it makes reference to the libmolcadplus library (whatever that is)
I tried googling for that library and I got 0 results ;_;

its because your libGL doesn't have glColorTableEXT. you could write a small c program that implements a non-functional version of glColorTableEXT and LD_PRELOAD that, but there isn't anything easy you can do
thanks a lot for your time
I'll contact the higher-ups at the Uni and let them know about this mess
